ygData.subject: They're off!

* Biomass stretched, feeling the inner workings of his new robotic form move 
along with him.
< I rather like this fowm.> he thought as he looked over towards his waking 
crew.
By now Sublime was already on her feet, brushing what little dust there was 
off of her.   Already she knew which race of the metal beings she would be 
studying, wondering when Biomass would give the order for them to go out and 
connect with those races.
Nue'e looked around the ship from where she sat on the floor, looking over 
at Stratus as he groans and stood up.
Her nature was a little skittish, always looking before she took the leap.
But Sublime, on the other hand, was the fun loving type. Taking advanture 
and danger with ease...and probably getting in trouble that she could have 
avoided if she would have thought first.
Nue'e didn't really find Sublime as the kind she could relate to and become 
friends, more like the kind who would probably make fun of her or something 
such as that.
Nue'e gave Sratus a " be nice!" glare when he spoke at Biomass, getting to 
her feet and pushing her glasses back up the bridge of her nose.
She stood off to the side a bit when she saw Biomass snap his head towards 
Stratus.*

" We'll leave when we leave and not before, Stratus." Biomass said sternly 
before looking his crew over.*
" We have a few things to go over first. You all know what you have to do 
but we'de better eat and get ourselves charged before we go embarking on the 
mission. Once fed you can leave when you like. But for myself, I'll go now."

* Biomass looked at Nue'e.*

" You and I go to the same place but you can catch up later."

* He turned and headed towards the door...which just suddenly appeared in 
the side of the room. It closed and sealed itself behind him, a hole in the 
floor appearing where water lapped at the edges.
           Outside the ship a giant grey squid jetted away from the great 
mass of the ship, stopping in surprise when a smaller seahorse joined him in 
the direction he was going.
Biomass's eyes narrowed.*

" Nue'e, I thought I told you to stay and eat something. This is nothing to 
charge into with an empty stomach."

* Nue'e only looked at him and then ahead.*

" I wasn't hungry."

* If there was anything she was, it was eager to see just what this new 
world was like.
So both headed towards a chunk of land several KM away from theyr current 
position, Biomass estimating that they would reach it by evening.*
